title: U.S. and global health officials are worried about lack of transparency from China on Covid outbreak
description: The U.S. in particular is worried that a new Covid variant could emerge in China as the virus spreads widely and rapidly.

title: Southwest Airlines says it expects normal operations on Friday after thousands of cancellations
description: Southwest canceled thousands of flights over the past week while other airlines stabilized after brutal winter storms.

title: The tech IPO market collapsed in 2022, and next year doesn't look much better
description: The only notable tech IPO in the U.S. this year was Intel's spinout of Mobileye, a company that had been public before it was acquired in 2017.

title: Pelé, Brazilian soccer star and only player to win the World Cup three times, dies at age 82
description: Brazilian soccer icon Pelé has died at age 82, his daughter announced.

title: Here's why egg prices surged in 2022. Those elevated costs could last into the first quarter of 2023, expert says
description: Egg prices have risen faster in the past year than any other grocery category. A deadly outbreak of bird flu in the U.S. is the primary culprit.

title: VanEck is winding down its Russia ETFs after invasion froze U.S. investing in Moscow
description: Russia ETFs plunged after the country's army invaded Ukraine, and sanctions effectively froze the funds in March.

title: Amazon lost half its value this year as tech stocks got crushed and recession fears grew
description: Shares of the e-commerce and cloud giant plunged 51% this year, wiping hundreds of billions of dollars off its market cap.

title: 2022 was tough for media stocks like Netflix and Disney, and 2023 doesn't look good, either
description: Netflix, Disney, Paramount and others lost billions in market value in 2022 as streaming subscriber growth slowed and the ad market tightened.

title: European natural gas prices return to pre-Ukraine war levels
description: European natural gas prices fell this week to the levels seen before Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: UK says no plans for Covid tests for China arrivals as Europe is pressured to tighten rules
description: Beijing on Monday dropped its quarantine on arrival policy, leading many to book their first overseas trips in years.

title: European markets slip as caution abounds to end the year
description: European markets retreated as caution returns to global stocks, with investors assessing a number of likely headwinds in 2023.

title: ABBA's successful avatar show in London offers a glimpse at a daring new direction for live music
description: ABBA Voyage has proved a hit with critics and fans, and industry professionals told CNBC it had redefined the parameters of AR-based entertainment.

title: Here's where Covid rules for visitors from China are changing
description: Some countries announced new Covid testing requirements for visitors from China after the mainland said it would finally relax border controls.

title: China reopening earlier than expected could hit supply chains in the short term, but boost growth in 2023
description: Mainland China's reopening came sooner than expected for investors, and Goldman Sachs warns it will bring a short-term strain in workforce and supply chains.

title: Most Chinese shoppers are very cautious about going out, survey finds
description: More than 90% of consumers surveyed over the weekend said they are avoiding going out, according to consulting firm Oliver Wyman.

title: Elon Musk tells Tesla employees don't be 'bothered by stock market craziness'
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sent a companywide email on Wednesday urging employees to stay focused and not to pay attention to the slumping stock price.

title: 'It's a lot more of headline risks than anything else': Analyst maintains bullish outlook on Apple
description: An analyst maintains a bullish outlook on Apple despite shares of the tech giant falling to their lowest since June 2021 amid continued iPhone supply concerns.

title: Singapore is set to hike its goods and services tax in January. Here's how it will work
description: Middle-income Singaporeans could be affected most by Singapore's GST hike, which is designed to support an increase government social spending.
